Sprint 1:
# Sprint 1 — Manual Test Scripts

**PRs**: #35 (Tone Fix), #36 (Auto-Save), #37 (Phase Infrastructure), #38 (Chat Markdown), #39 (Phase UI)

**Staging URL**: https://leadgen-staging.visionvolve.com/
**Login**: `test@staging.local` / `staging123`
**Playbook URL**: After login, go to `/visionvolve/playbook`

> To test a specific PR revision, append `?rev={commit-hash}` to the URL.
> Example: `https://leadgen-staging.visionvolve.com/visionvolve/playbook?rev=abc1234`

---

## PR #35 — AI Tone Fix + TODOs + Document Awareness

**Branch**: `feature/playbook-tone`

### Preconditions
- Logged in as `test@staging.local`
- On the Playbook page (`/visionvolve/playbook`)
- Strategy editor is visible on the left, AI chat on the right

### Test 35.1 — No harsh language for companies with limited data

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | In the strategy editor, type: "Target company: QuietStartup Ltd. They are a 3-person team with no website and no LinkedIn presence." | Text appears in the editor | [ ] |
| 2 | In the AI chat, type: "What do you think about QuietStartup as a prospect?" and press Enter | AI responds about the company | [ ] |
| 3 | Read the AI response carefully | The response must NOT contain any of these phrases: "DISQUALIFY", "no verifiable business presence", "minimal digital footprint", "red flag", "low-quality lead", "not worth pursuing" | [ ] |
| 4 | Check the overall tone of the response | The tone should be collaborative and constructive | [ ] |

### Test 35.2 — TODO markers for sparse data

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | In the AI chat, type: "Help me analyze the competitive landscape for QuietStartup's market" and press Enter | AI responds with analysis | [ ] |
| 2 | Read the AI response | The response should include visible TODO markers (e.g., `[TODO: ...]`) with concrete examples | [ ] |
| 3 | Check the TODO examples | Each TODO should suggest a specific action, not just generic placeholders | [ ] |

### Test 35.3 — Document awareness (AI references existing content)

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Clear the strategy editor and type: "ICP: B2B SaaS companies, 50-200 employees, Series A/B funded, based in DACH region. Pain point: manual lead qualification taking 10+ hours per week." | Text appears in the editor | [ ] |
| 2 | In the AI chat, type: "What should our ICP look like?" and press Enter | AI responds about ICP | [ ] |
| 3 | Read the AI response | The AI must reference the ICP information you already wrote in the document | [ ] |
| 4 | Ask the AI: "What pain points should we focus on?" | The AI should reference "manual lead qualification" from the document | [ ] |

### Test 35.4 — Guidance when document is empty

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Clear all text from the strategy editor (select all, delete) | Editor is empty | [ ] |
| 2 | In the AI chat, type: "Help me with my GTM strategy" and press Enter | AI responds | [ ] |
| 3 | Read the AI response | The AI should guide you to start filling in sections of the strategy document | [ ] |

---

## PR #36 — Auto-Save

**Branch**: `feature/playbook-autosave`

### Preconditions
- Logged in as `test@staging.local`
- On the Playbook page (`/visionvolve/playbook`)
- Strategy editor is visible

### Test 36.1 — Save button removed

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Look at the playbook editor area | There should be NO "Save" button anywhere on the page | [ ] |

### Test 36.2 — Auto-save after typing stops

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Click into the strategy editor | Cursor is active in the editor | [ ] |
| 2 | Type a few words: "Testing auto-save feature" | Text appears in the editor | [ ] |
| 3 | Stop typing and watch for a save indicator | Within about 2 seconds, you should see "Saving..." then "Saved" | [ ] |
| 4 | Wait 2 more seconds after "Saved" appears | The "Saved" indicator should fade away | [ ] |

### Test 36.3 — Cmd/Ctrl+S instant save

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Type some new text: "Immediate save test" | Text appears | [ ] |
| 2 | Immediately press Cmd+S (Mac) or Ctrl+S (Windows) | The "Saving..." indicator should appear immediately | [ ] |
| 3 | Verify the browser does not show its own "Save page" dialog | The keyboard shortcut should be captured by the app | [ ] |

### Test 36.4 — Content persists after refresh

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Type a unique phrase: "Persistence check 12345" | Text appears | [ ] |
| 2 | Wait for the "Saved" indicator to appear | Shows "Saved" | [ ] |
| 3 | Refresh the page (Cmd+R / Ctrl+R or F5) | Page reloads | [ ] |
| 4 | Check the strategy editor content | The text "Persistence check 12345" should still be there | [ ] |

### Test 36.5 — Rapid typing does not cause lag

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Click into the editor | Cursor active | [ ] |
| 2 | Type continuously and quickly for about 10 seconds | Text should appear smoothly with no visible lag. No "Saving..." while typing. | [ ] |
| 3 | Stop typing | "Saving..." then "Saved" should appear after you stop | [ ] |

### Test 36.6 — Save failure indication (network disconnect)

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Open browser DevTools (Cmd+Option+I / F12) | DevTools opens | [ ] |
| 2 | Go to the Network tab and check "Offline" | Network is now disconnected | [ ] |
| 3 | Type some text in the editor: "Offline save test" | Text appears | [ ] |
| 4 | Wait for the save attempt | A "Save failed" or error indicator should appear | [ ] |
| 5 | Uncheck "Offline" in DevTools to restore the network | Network restored | [ ] |
| 6 | Type one more character or press Cmd+S | The save should retry and succeed | [ ] |

---

## PR #37 — Phase Infrastructure

**Branch**: `feature/playbook-phases`

### Test 37.1 — Default phase is "strategy"

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Open DevTools Network tab | DevTools open | [ ] |
| 2 | Refresh the playbook page | Network requests appear | [ ] |
| 3 | Find the request to `GET /api/playbook` | Response JSON should include `"phase": "strategy"` | [ ] |
| 4 | Check the response includes `"playbook_selections"` | Should show `"playbook_selections": {}` | [ ] |

### Test 37.2 — Cannot advance without ICP extracted

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Open DevTools Console tab | Console is open | [ ] |
| 2 | Call the phase advance API (see test script for details) | Request is made | [ ] |
| 3 | Read the response | Should return an error indicating ICP data must be extracted first | [ ] |

### Test 37.3 — Advance after ICP is present

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Write ICP information and trigger extraction | ICP data is saved | [ ] |
| 2 | Repeat the phase advance API call | Should succeed — phase changed to "contacts" | [ ] |
| 3 | Refresh and check `GET /api/playbook` | `"phase": "contacts"` | [ ] |

### Test 37.4 — Phase-aware AI behavior

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | While in "strategy" phase, ask: "What should I do next?" | Response should be strategy-focused | [ ] |
| 2 | If in "contacts" phase, ask the same question | Response should be contacts-focused | [ ] |

---

## PR #38 — Chat Markdown Rendering

**Branch**: `feature/playbook-chat-md`

### Test 38.1 — Markdown formatting in AI responses

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Ask: "What sections should a GTM strategy include?" | AI responds | [ ] |
| 2 | Look at the AI response formatting | Should use rich formatting: bold, bullets, headings. No raw markdown. | [ ] |

### Test 38.2 — Table rendering

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Ask: "Show me a comparison table of inbound vs outbound channels" | AI responds with a table | [ ] |
| 2 | Check the table formatting | Should render as an actual HTML table, not raw pipe characters | [ ] |

### Test 38.3 — Code block rendering

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Ask: "Write a code example showing how to call a REST API in Python" | AI responds with code | [ ] |
| 2 | Check the code block formatting | Should appear in a styled code block with monospace font | [ ] |

### Test 38.4 — User messages remain plain text

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Type: "Here is **bold** and a [link](https://example.com)" | Your message appears | [ ] |
| 2 | Look at YOUR message bubble | Should show as plain text, not formatted markdown | [ ] |

### Test 38.5 — Concise responses (no filler)

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Ask: "What is account-based marketing?" | AI responds | [ ] |
| 2 | Check response length | Should be 2-4 sentences or a short bullet list | [ ] |
| 3 | Check the first sentence | Should NOT start with filler phrases like "Great question!" | [ ] |

### Test 38.6 — Document awareness in responses

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Write: "Our main channel is LinkedIn outreach targeting CTOs." | Text saved | [ ] |
| 2 | Ask: "How should we approach our outreach?" | AI responds | [ ] |
| 3 | Check the response | Should reference LinkedIn and CTOs from the document | [ ] |

## PR #39 — Phase UI

**Branch**: `feature/playbook-phase-ui`

### Test 39.1 — Phase stepper visible

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Look at the top of the playbook page | A horizontal phase stepper: Strategy > Contacts > Messages > Campaign | [ ] |
| 2 | Check which phase is active | "Strategy" should be highlighted/active | [ ] |

### Test 39.2 — Locked phases cannot be clicked

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Click on "Contacts" | Nothing should happen — locked/grayed out | [ ] |
| 2 | Click on "Messages" | Same — locked | [ ] |
| 3 | Click on "Campaign" | Same — locked | [ ] |

### Test 39.3 — Locked phase tooltip

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Hover over the locked "Contacts" phase | A tooltip should appear explaining why it is locked | [ ] |

### Test 39.4 — Phase-specific left panel (Strategy)

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Verify you are on the Strategy phase | Stepper shows Strategy as active | [ ] |
| 2 | Look at the left panel | Should show the strategy editor | [ ] |

### Test 39.5 — URL routing

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Check the browser URL bar | Should include `/playbook` | [ ] |
| 2 | Manually navigate to `/visionvolve/playbook/campaign` | Should redirect back to the current unlocked phase | [ ] |
| 3 | Check the URL after redirect | Should be at `/visionvolve/playbook` or `/visionvolve/playbook/strategy` | [ ] |

### Test 39.6 — Unlocking and navigating to Contacts

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | Complete Strategy: write ICP and trigger extraction | ICP is extracted and saved | [ ] |
| 2 | Look at the phase stepper | "Contacts" should now appear unlocked | [ ] |
| 3 | Click on "Contacts" | Should navigate to the contacts phase | [ ] |
| 4 | Check the left panel | Should show contacts-specific content | [ ] |
| 5 | Check AI chat placeholder | Should show contacts-phase-specific placeholder | [ ] |

### Test 39.7 — Backward navigation

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | From Contacts, click "Strategy" in the stepper | Should navigate back to Strategy | [ ] |
| 2 | Verify the strategy editor shows saved content | Content should still be there | [ ] |

### Test 39.8 — Phase-specific action buttons

| # | Step | Expected Result | Pass/Fail |
|---|------|-----------------|----------|
| 1 | On Strategy phase, look for action buttons | Should show strategy-relevant actions | [ ] |
| 2 | Navigate to Contacts phase (if unlocked) | Action buttons should change to contacts-relevant actions | [ ] |

Sprint 2:
# Sprint 2 — Manual Test Scripts

**Target**: Staging (https://leadgen-staging.visionvolve.com/)
**Login**: `test@staging.local` / `staging123`

> Test steps TBD — will be filled when PRs are created.

---

## Feature: Persistent Chat History

**What it does**: Chat messages persist across page refreshes and sessions. Previous conversation history loads when you return to the playbook.

**Test steps**: TBD

---

## Feature: Agent-Ready Chat Architecture

**What it does**: Chat backend refactored to support streaming responses and multi-turn agent conversations. Foundation for AI writing to the document.

**Test steps**: TBD

---

## Feature: Transparent AI Thinking

**What it does**: AI shows its reasoning process (thinking/planning steps) before giving its final response. Users can see how the AI arrived at its answer.

**Test steps**: TBD

---

## Feature: Chat Writes to Document

**What it does**: AI can directly insert or modify content in the strategy document based on chat conversation. User confirms changes before they are applied.

**Test steps**: TBD

---

| Feature | Tests | Status |
|---------|-------|--------|
| Persistent Chat History | TBD | [ ] |
| Agent-Ready Chat | TBD | [ ] |
| Transparent Thinking | TBD | [ ] |
| Chat Writes Doc | TBD | [ ] |

Sprint 3:
# Sprint 3 — Manual Test Scripts

**Target**: Staging (https://leadgen-staging.visionvolve.com/)
**Login**: `test@staging.local` / `staging123`

> Test steps TBD — will be filled when PRs are created.

---

## Feature: Smart Onboarding Flow

**What it does**: First-time users get a guided onboarding experience that walks them through creating their first GTM strategy. The AI asks structured questions to populate the strategy document.

**Test steps**: TBD

---

## Feature: Chat Internet Access (Web Research)

**What it does**: AI can search the web during chat to find real-time information about companies, markets, and competitors. Results are cited with sources.

**Test steps**: TBD

---

## Feature: Contacts Analyzer

**What it does**: In the Contacts phase, AI analyzes imported contact lists against the ICP criteria and scores/ranks them. Provides recommendations on which contacts to prioritize.

**Test steps**: TBD

---

## Feature: GTM Strategy Templates

**What it does**: Pre-built strategy templates for common GTM scenarios (e.g., "B2B SaaS launching in new market", "Agency targeting SMBs"). Users can start from a template instead of a blank page.

**Test steps**: TBD

---
